External_Reference.reference_text: Vernov, S. N., Chudakov, A. E., Vakulov, P. V., Gorchakov, E. V., Ignatiev, P. P., Kontor, N. N., Kusnetsov, S. N., Logachev, Yu. I. Lyubimov, G. P., Nikolaev, A. G., Pereslegina, N. V., A study of solar and cosmic radiation from the VENERA-4 space probe, Space Res., Proc., Tokyo, vol. 9, 203-214, 1969.

Vernov, S. N., Chudakov, A. E., Vakulov, P. V., Gorchakov, E. V., Ignatiev, P. P., Kontor, N. N., Logachev, Yu. I., Lyubimov, G. P., Nikolaev, A. G., Pereslegina, N. V., Measurement of cosmic rays and searching for radiation belts nearby Venus, in Physics of Moon and Planets (in Russian), Nauka, 397-402, 1972.

Ermakov, S. I., Kontor, N. N., Liubimov, G. P., Pereslegina, N. V., Khotilovskaia, T. G., Comparison of Solar Proton Activity in 1967 and 1969 with that in 1978 and 1979 as Measured on board VENERA-4, 6, 11, 12 Space Probes Proc. 17th Int. Cosmic Ray Conf, Paris, France, vol. 3, 81-84, 1981.

Instrument.name: Venera 4 Energetic Particles, MSU-TASPD
Instrument.description: The Venera 4 Energetic Particles experiment was a Soviet suite of particle detectors that monitored the flux of charged particles of medium energies in interplanetary space during cruise and Venus approach, specifically measuring protons (>30 and 1-5 MeV) from the sunward direction; and protons (1-5 MeV) and electrons (>0.05 MeV) from the anti-sunward direction.
